a1: PEM (Privacy Enhanced Mail) is a Base64-encoded format for storing certificates, keys, and other cryptographic data, enclosed between -----BEGIN and -----END markers.
a2: You can see the certificate version, serial number, signature algorithm, issuer, subject (CN, O, OU, C), and validity period.
a3: Yes, all decoding happens in your browser. No data is transmitted to any server.
a4: The tool can detect private keys but for security reasons only shows basic format information. Never share your private keys online.
